chapter.title: OpenAM Changes & Deprecated Functionality
chapter.para: This chapter covers both major changes to existing functionality, and also deprecated and removed functionality.

listitem.para: The internal representation of session objects has changed.

If you use session failover and depend on OpenMQ rather than the new implementation, you must ensure that OpenMQ is cleared as part of the upgrade to OpenAM . To clear OpenMQ, run amsfo stop and then run amsfo start.

JBoss v4.2 & v5.x
Jetty v6.1 & v7
Tomcat v6
WebSphere v6.1
WebLogic v10

Prior to OpenAM 9.5.2, trailing slashes (/) were ignored when matching resource names in policy evaluation. Therefore, /-*- matched /secret, but also /secret/, short for /secret/index.html on most web servers.
Now, /-*- matches /secret, but not /secret/.

Since OpenAM 9.5.3, application shutdown hooks are no longer registered by default. This change only has an effect on standalone and web applications that use the OpenAM Client SDK. The changes do not affect OpenAM, distributed authentication services, or the Java EE policy agents.

Privileged console access is now disabled by default. To enable privileged console access for specific users, set the console.privileged.users advanced property as described in the OpenAM Reference section, Servers > Advanced.
In earlier versions the default root suffix DN for OpenAM configuration and profile data was dc=opensso,dc=java,dc=net. The default root suffix is now .

section.title: Deprecated Functionality
section.para: The following functionality is deprecated in OpenAM .

listitem.para: The Netscape LDAP API is to be removed from OpenAM, with OpenAM using the OpenDJ LDAP SDK instead. This affects all classes in com.sun.identity.shared.ldap.* packages.
Support for Liberty Identity Web Services Framework (ID-WSF) is deprecated. The functionality is likely to be removed in a future release.
OpenAM currently uses Sun Java System Application Framework (JATO). JATO is deprecated and is likely to be replaced in a future release.

section.title: Removed Functionality
section.para: With the implementation of OAuth 2.0 in OpenAM release 10.1.0, OAuth 1.0 is no longer supported. OAuth 1.0 was originally released in OpenAM 9.
OpenAM does not include the amtune command.
OpenAM console only mode is no longer supported. Console only mode is likely to be replaced with a different solution in a future release.
The Test Beta Console has been removed. Its functionality is currently available through the ssoadm command.
OpenAM no longer includes the SafeWord and Unix authentication modules.
